instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2899: What is 820-2899? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message:
I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b after water damage repair the macbook boot super slow the water damage was around the keyboard connector area i replaced the keyboard connector because was damaged. Any ideas??? i 

its not the HDD i already checked also check the HDD cable and try to boot from USB same result. Also try to boot with nothing plugged but HDD, LCD and RAM still same. Any suggestions ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message: Run ASD and check sensor errors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message: I can't Enter in ASD. If i hold option button let me choose HDD i connect to network and check all the key on keyboard if they work because i replaced the keyboard connector so the keys are working but lagging when i press. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message: could it be corrupt ME region in BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message: I guess this is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LB, it is intel core 2 duo, so, no ME region on this board.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message:
No Title

Actually was bad camera connector that's why wouldn't boot im actually surprised J3402 there is 2 lines connected with the SMC. <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_A_S3_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_A_S3_SDA</SIGNAL>. After replacing the connector macbook is working perfect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message: If you would've booted ASD it would have given an error, the EFI version. The ambient light sensor is on that bus together with a few sensors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2899</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B super slow boot almost does't boot in OS
threads.message: Yes true but i couldn't boot the computer in ASD so i started to unplug all the unnecessary devices i left the HDD only and it boot properly so when i plug the camera cable didn't wanna boot so i replaced the connector to solve my problem. Thanks for the response i really appreciate it
